channel.title: Headset with mic
channel.description:
I am looking for a wireless headset with a microphone in the price range of about 25-45$.
They don't have to be fancy, colorful, nothing like that.
I just need a basic pair that is going to feel comfortable to wear for like 2-3 hours a day. Needs to be able to fit a larger head ( Adult - larger person )
All the different electronic sites I have looked at they aren't very specific in the sense of "comfort"
I am not picky about "sound quality" as long as it works I will be alright.

item.title: Headset with mic
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

You won’t get cheap wireless voice chat. Just using turtle beach as an example: Their X32s ($99) are the first wireless headset. The game sounds are wireless, and so can be used on the PC just fine wireless, but voice chat requires the cable running from headset -> controller/pc. You won’t get 100% wireless until the XP300s ($169).

Most gaming headsets will have a very long cable because they know how far away the console can be sometimes, and now it needs to be hidden etc.

Read full topic

item.description:

They don’t, I’m sure you can get an extension of some sort for it though.

item.title: Headset with mic
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:14, topic:518624”]I personally use turtle beach P11’s, not wireless but they have a pretty long cable and are great quality. They’re completely PC compatible.[/quote]those look nice only issue is that I really need a 15-20 ft cable.

Do all of these good headsets come with like “re-attachable” cables of some kind?

Read full topic

item.title: Headset with mic
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:9, topic:518624”]Probably not in your price range, but probably the best thing I’ve done in regards to my gaming/computer use, is set my headphones up.

Sennheiser HD 518 ($150)
Labtec LVA-7330 boom-mic

And used double sided tape to attach the mic to the side of my headphones. This is plugged into an Astro Mixamp Pro, which is plugged into a Xonar DX sound card (this is overkill for the PC, but keep in mind this also allows me to simultaneously use it for my xbox etc)[/quote]too expensive for my taste sorry

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:8, topic:518624”]The cables are super long, very surprised their not long enough lol[/quote]I use a 70 inch tv to play games/skype and shit so it won’t be long enough cause I sit so far back

Read full topic

item.title: Headset with mic
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Probably not in your price range, but probably the best thing I’ve done in regards to my gaming/computer use, is set my headphones up.

Sennheiser HD 518 ($150)
Labtec LVA-7330 boom-mic

And used double sided tape to attach the mic to the side of my headphones. This is plugged into an Astro Mixamp Pro, which is plugged into a Xonar DX sound card (this is overkill for the PC, but keep in mind this also allows me to simultaneously use it for my xbox etc)

Read full topic

item.title: Headset with mic
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I had the x12s for a short period of time but I got the bo2 headset not long after which is pretty much the same and I can tell you their a lil bit uncomfortable at times + if you wear glasses they can be annoying.
The headset itself is pretty good.
This is how you setup the headset for the PC and he links you where to buy the lil $1 or so jack you need.

Read full topic

item.title: Headset with mic
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

I use it for Xbox and PC, the cord is VERY long, enough that I can sit comfortably with a laptop on a desk and not have it nearly being tugged off my head or anything. They didn’t go cheap on the wire. It isn’t wireless but imo it doesn’t need to be.

Read full topic

item.title: Headset with mic
item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Truth Cruel Truth
item.description:
@Cruel_Truth wrote:

Elrick:

Turtle beach x12. They’re around $50.00 USD, but they’re worth it. I can use them up to 6 hours at a time without my ears feeling sore or anything. They’re a tad pricey for what you’re looking for, but when my girlfriend bought me them it instantly became probably one of my favorite gifts ever.

Are you referring to these?

http://www.bestbuy.com/site/Turtle-Beach---Ear-Force-X12-Gaming-Headset-for-Xbox-360/3302112.p?id=1218394225104&skuId=3302112

I think it said it was PC compatible but want to make sure with you? How about wireless? I read something about a usb port so didn’t know if it was talking about wireless or corded usb.

Read full topic
